required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Registry Study of Aneurysmal SAH
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Registry Study of Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage

brief_summary.textblock: Firstly, this study aims at clarifying the current situation of Emergency treatment of aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) in China, and analyzing the influencing factors contributing to transport delay, so as to improve the efficiency of emergency treatment; Secondly, comparison and analysis of different surgical treatment of aneurysmal SAH would be undertook, so as to improve the diagnosis and treatment of aneurysmal SAH.

primary_outcome.time_frame: the time interval would be noted and be analyzed through study completion, an average of 6 months.
primary_outcome.description: the time interval between admission to hospital and puncture

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the time interval would be noted and be analyzed through study completion, an average of 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: the time interval between admission to hospital and time of CT performed

other_outcome.time_frame: the time interval would be noted and be analyzed through study completion, an average of 6 months.
other_outcome.description: the time interval between onset of symptom and admission to hospital

study_pop.textblock: patients presented with subarachnoid hemorrhage and diagnosed with ruptured aneurysm at all age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients presented with subarachnoid hemorrhage on CT or lumbar puncture.
- the intracranial hemorrhage was caused by rupture of aneurysm and was confirmed on CTA、MRA or DSA.
- patients willing to participate in this clinical trial and attach to regular follow up.
Exclusion Criteria:
- intracranial aneurysm correlating to AVM.
- dissection, false, traumatic and infectious aneurysms.
- the rupture of the aneurysm can not be confirmed on CTA、MRA or DSA.
